item.title: Duplicate Functions on rbt.h
item.description: Are the duplicate functions on your rbt.h sample intentional?
item.content:encoded: Are the duplicate functions on your rbt.h sample intentional?

item.title: test dropbox
item.description: The test2 dropbox is up and running. At the moment, it only tests your TNODE and BST classes.
item.content:encoded: The test2 dropbox is up and running. At the moment, it only tests your TNODE and BST classes.

item.title: Project specifications
item.description:
One type of development is called bottom-up, meaning you build an application by first implementing the more basic and fundamental pieces first and then the code that uses these pieces later. Here are some fundamental pieces that are ready, in order of increasing complexity:

Binary Search Tree Node
Binary Search Tree

I will add more as I finish those specifications.
item.content:encoded:
One type of development is called bottom-up, meaning you build an application by first implementing the more basic and fundamental pieces first and then the code that uses these pieces later. Here are some fundamental pieces that are ready, in order of increasing complexity:

Binary Search Tree
